serinfo.issue: 2008 World, Europe, United States, Canada, and Mexico

descript.abstract:
United States Lakes (Generalized) is a polygon theme representing the major lakes within the United States. Attribute information includes the name and area of the lake.
This dataset is a part of the 2008 ESRI Data & Maps collection.
descript.purpose: United States Lakes (Generalized) provides a base map layer of major lakes of United States.
descript.supplinf: Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:5,000,000.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States: Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local ESRI Regional Office. For support, you may contact ESRI Support Center by telephone (voice) between 6:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com/; ESRI holidays excluded.
Outside the United States Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local ESRI International Distributor. This information can be found at http://gis.esri.com/intldist/contact/.
For other questions or comments, you may contact ESRI headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 2000 Version 5.0 (Build 2195) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 8.3.0.800

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using either ESRI SDC Data Development Kit Professional 2 (DDKP2) or tools in ArcGIS. The SDC data set is then loaded into ArcSDE to verify and validate the geometry.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

horizpa.horizpar: The geospatial part of this data set was extracted from the ArcWorld 1:3M database and then generalized (tolerance unknown). The positional accuracy is unknown.

citeinfo.title: The Times Atlas of the World

serinfo.sername: The Times Atlas of the World

citeinfo.origin: Defense Mapping Agency, presently known as National Imagery and Mapping Agency
citeinfo.title: Digital Chart of the World

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by ESRI: Extracted and generalized the features from ArcWorld 1:3M. Added Name attribute values from the Rand McNally New International Atlas, the Times Atlas of the World, and the Digital Chart of the World. Converted to North American Datum of 1983 (NAD83) by splitting the United States into-if present: Alaska, Hawaii, Puerto Rico, U.S. Virgin Islands-and the 48 contiguous states (including District of Columbia); converting each to NAD83; then merging them together. Recalculated Area attribute. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr). Created projection file (.prj). Ran ArcView GIS Avenue request ExportClean, and created spatial indices. Converted the data set to SDC.

enttyp.enttypd: The polygons represent the major natural and human-made bodies of water within United States.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The lake area in square miles using Albers Equal Area projection.

attr.attrdefs: Rand McNally New International Atlas; The Times Atlas of the World; Digital Chart of the World

stdorder.ordering: ESRI Data & Maps is available only as part of ESRI software.

distinfo.techpreq: To use this data requires software that supports SDC files.
